Question: call a method with a concatenated string: :In Java I want to call a method in a for loopfor(int i = 0; i < 5; i++ ){ myMethod.get + Integer.toString(i)(theValue);}where the method called is named myMethod.get1, myMethod.get2, myMethod.get3 ...Can this be done?
Please using this api: Map.get.
Answer: <<<api>>>: $API
Map.get
<<<code>>>: $CODE
for(int i = 0; i < 5; i++ ){
    String methodName = "myMethod.get" + Integer.toString(i);
    map.get(methodName);
}
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION
This code will create a string with the name of the method to be called. The method names are "myMethod.get1", "myMethod.get2", etc. The map.get method is then called with the dynamically created method name as a string. This will call the corresponding method from the map.
